qas.question: What was the Prussian Army composed of, instead of regulars?
Service was mandatory for all men sharing which feature?
Together, Prussia and Germany expected to amass how many soldiers?
German tactics relied on what type of battle strategy?
What is an example of a German encirclement battle?

context: The Prussian Army was composed not of regulars but <a0_0>conscripts<a0_0/>. Service was compulsory for all of men <a1_0>of military age<a1_0/>, and thus Prussia and its North and South German allies could mobilise and field some <a2_0>1,000,000<a2_0/> soldiers in time of war. German tactics emphasised <a3_0>encirclement battles<a3_0/> like <a4_0>Cannae<a4_0/> and using artillery offensively whenever possible. Rather than advancing in a column or line formation, Prussian infantry moved in small groups that were harder to target by artillery or French defensive fire. The sheer number of soldiers available made encirclement en masse and destruction of French formations relatively easy.
